commit_message:
Expanded docstrings for library subpackage.

Reintroduces the __init__.py in library dir, to help with
doc building. apidoc seems to get confused without it.

Plus it allows for writing general into to the subpkg.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I72b7a665da482d84b7b3e4d5560c75c8af7111d7

[{'created': '2021-06-30 09:13:18.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate back haproxy validation to tripleo-validations

This patch moves back the haproxy validation from validations-common to
tripleo-validations. It has been renamed in tripleo-haproxy and the role
is called now tripleo_haproxy.

This patch also fix the host targeting in order to only execute this
validation on nodes where haproxy is really installed and configured.

Note that the haproxy validations hosted in validations-common will be
removed in a follow up patch.

commit_message:
Migrate back haproxy validation to tripleo-validations

This patch moves back the haproxy validation from validations-common to
tripleo-validations. It has been renamed in tripleo-haproxy and the role
is called now tripleo_haproxy.

This patch also fix the host targeting in order to only execute this
validation on nodes where haproxy is really installed and configured.

Note that the haproxy validations hosted in validations-common will be
removed in a follow up patch.

Closes-Bug: #1926024

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9869afd60342fdb0aca69a313c1c6e35e0947fb8
(cherry picked from commit 9dd662a1b9d5617e1a929c86f6ffdb09e873252b)
(cherry picked from commit 253a16de422b5f22bb1b9e68ffa14e855a22d243)

commit_message:
Change from mac to ports on the instackenv.json.j2

As macs have been deprecated, modify the instackenv file to
use ports instead of mac.

Closes-bug: #1934133
Change-Id: I12a76cc01e39e19383c4de9d34002b044031e71e

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)

commit_message:
Enabling indentation rule for yamllint.

With the exception of release notes, yaml files will
now have to be indented with a consistent number of whitespace chars.

As described:
https://yamllint.readthedocs.io/en/stable/rules.html#module-yamllint.rules.indentation

Also fixes indentaion for the zuul.d/molecule.yaml.
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-common/+/797860
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I280cea451114a0c63bec9ae0f4dc2c85e3d3de90
(cherry picked from commit c1277a5e5cc6af20cebe432be34d5b82624a3e6c)

commit_message:
Adding static invenory param to tripleo_validator_run

The param is needed to run validations without authentication by providing a static inventory file

commit_message:
Add project validation to volume type access

Validate the project provided by the user with keystone
if it is a valid project or not.

Change-Id: I1f2548211a78a353ddcd709d9369d0ff41eddb31

commit_message:
Redfish: Skip non-RAID controllers for RAID

Avoid processing non-RAID controllers as they cannot be
used for RAID operations to save some time and requests
and avoid possible errors later if non-RAID disks
are picked up for configuration.

Related to: I369bdbb17064baf34f90e864d0ece600529de509

Change-Id: I728f03dc829fb76cad9804c8f8df20810307ce2c

commit_message:
Update the clear job id's constant

Fixes an issue of powering off with the ``idrac-wsman`` management
interface while the execution of a clear job queue cleaning step is
proceeding.
Prior to this fix, the clean step would fail when powering off a node.

Story: 2008988
Task: 42641

Change-Id: Ib4ab755c806f028d97379b80a8c27d6ade63cba1
(cherry picked from commit 741a4d8a88bbc51f5903fc00cc4f1decf8f4ea1a)

[{'created': '2021-07-02 10:00:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use "multiprocessing.Queue" for "TestNeutronServer" related tests

Instead of using a file to log the processes status and actions,
"TestNeutronServer" now uses a "multiprocessing.Queue" that is
safer than writting a single file accross multiple processes.

Change-Id: I6d04df180cd9b2d593bb99c8d22a60a3534f22a0
Closes-Bug: #1930367
(cherry picked from commit da760973be09a98a1fc07c519e74a11899cb4aa5)
'}]
commit_message:
Use "multiprocessing.Queue" for "TestNeutronServer" related tests

Instead of using a file to log the processes status and actions,
"TestNeutronServer" now uses a "multiprocessing.Queue" that is
safer than writting a single file accross multiple processes.

Change-Id: I6d04df180cd9b2d593bb99c8d22a60a3534f22a0
Closes-Bug: #1930367
(cherry picked from commit da760973be09a98a1fc07c519e74a11899cb4aa5)

commit_message:
[xfs_check_ftype] Add role documentation in sphinx

This patch adds the documentation directly in the sphinx role
documentation index. All variables have been commented with a proper
description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch also disables the facts gathering as the validation doesn't
need them.

Change-Id: I90b48b8f1de6ef72f6c0695129ec990137a50219
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[check_disk_space] Add role documentation in sphinx

This patch adds the documentation directly in the sphinx role
documentation index. All variables have been commented with a proper
description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch also disables the fact gathering as this validation doesn't
use them at all.

Change-Id: I6e4b95faadf2e300030d476c75e6283237b43719
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enforce some better rights on temporary files

We probably don't want to expose the SELinux issues, so let's use some
better rights on the temporary files.

Change-Id: I9b27a068129d694577bb3b0ab7374934f06c5655

subject: [validate_selinux] Add role documentation in sphinx
messages:
[{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-24 09:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-06-24 15:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-24 19:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-25 07:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-06-25 08:40:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

might be worth adding some more security around the temporary files - I didn't really think about that aspect back then. I can probably add the needed things if needed."}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-25 08:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-06-25 09:17:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Note: to address David's legitimate question, I just pushed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-common/+/798060 in order to enforce some better rights on the files."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-06-25 13:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-06-25 13:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Note: to address David's legitimate question, I just pushed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-common/+/798060 in order to enforce some better rights on the files.

Thanks Cedric.

/tmp has been a very common attack vector for as long as it's been around, and should mostly be used for trivial and non-security related items.  SELinux being what it is, we should probably as a rule avoid using /tmp for it.

Interesting reading:

https://systemd.io/TEMPORARY_DIRECTORIES/
http://0pointer.net/blog/projects/tmp.html

Takeaway - more often than not /tmp is not the right place for one's use case."}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-28 09:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > Note: to address David's legitimate question, I just pushed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-common/+/798060 in order to enforce some better rights on the files.
> 
> Thanks Cedric.
> 
> /tmp has been a very common attack vector for as long as it's been around, and should mostly be used for trivial and non-security related items.  SELinux being what it is, we should probably as a rule avoid using /tmp for it.
> 
> Interesting reading:
> 
> https://systemd.io/TEMPORARY_DIRECTORIES/
> http://0pointer.net/blog/projects/tmp.html
> 
> Takeaway - more often than not /tmp is not the right place for one's use case.

so, just to be clear: the information we can get out of SELinux at this point are denials - meaning "locked holes". So the actual security impact is close to nothing, though the filter used to exclude some of the denials from the list MIGHT be more important. And, even then, the attack vector would be mostly local. If a bad user has access to that kind of data, you might have some other issues to correct at this point ;).
But, yes, of course, proper right management is important (hence my patch), but in some places, using /tmp for temporary files is correct, if there's no credential for instance. SELinux doesn't provide actual sensitive data.

Just to be clear: the audit.log IS sensitive, because there might be non-SELinux data with credentials.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-06-29 09:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-07-01 13:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-07-05 13:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-07-05 14:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
[validate_selinux] Add role documentation in sphinx

This patch adds the documentation directly in the sphinx role
documentation index. All variables have been commented with a proper
description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch changes the default value for the
validate_selinux_working_dir variable to /tmp instead of
/var/log/validations to be consistent with the default used in the
playbook.

Moreover, this validation will warn the user when Untracked SELinux AVCs
are found instead of using the debug module and the strict mode
information is now displayed at the end.

NB: this patch also explicitly disables the facts gathering because this
validation doesn't need them.

Change-Id: Id337cbd89ab9368ee7e02d9c710861b134929ec7
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[ntp] Add role documentation in sphinx

This patch adds the documentation directly in the sphinx role
documentation index. All variables have been commented with a proper
description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch also disable the facts gathering because this validation
doesn't need them and only uses service_facts in the ntp role.

Change-Id: I3a19eb0a93f6dfaaf7a4361b46b2dc904aeb7ae6
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch also disables the fact gathering as this validation doesn't
need them at all.

Change-Id: Ica37eb5a2b1edf883d701f523a12eb47264fed7c
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[check_selinux_mode] Add role documentation in sphinx

This patch adds the documentation directly in the sphinx role
documentation index. All variables have been commented with a proper
description to be included automatically in the sphinx build.

This patch also fixes the facts gathering by being sure we get only the
needed facts.

Change-Id: Ifbe7bd73559b05f6655bfd396029c22345b75f4c
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[check_ram] Remove README.md file

This patch removes the README.md file and adds the documentation
directly in the sphinx role documentation index. All variables have been
commented with a proper description to be included automatically in the
sphinx build.

Change-Id: I36c9a86eabb9a297f75c9a4ca2bde8aaa0a1fcd3
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 09:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for compute services before sanity check.

After upgrading the Overcloud nodes, a sanity check is executed
in which an instance is launched and then removed. However, as it
runs right after the upgrade it can happen that some compute services
are still bringing up when the sanity test is run. An active loop is
being added to wait for all compute services to be up before jumping
into the sanity check.

Change-Id: I0b4baaeb2d807e51ba182ba3442176d8d85a4b95

commit_message:
Refactor workload script

* Add sanity_check function to verify cluster before starting any
  workloads.
* Rename flavor to include the actual memory limit
* Add flavor removal on sanity_teardown
* Add - to jinja templates to exclude unneeded extra new lines

Change-Id: I0b4baaeb2d807e51ba182ba3442176d8d85a4b95

commit_message:
rbd: Mark the initialize_connection API as idempotent in connection_info

As with I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a for the NFS driver
this change adds a simple initialize_idempotent flag to the
connection_info returned by calls to the initialize_connection API for
the RBD volume driver.

A NOTE and FIXME are left detailing a wrinkle when using the cinderv3
attachment update API that results in this key ending up in the nested
data dict that means this key has been added directly to this dict while
strictly not belonging there.

Change-Id: Ibc62dd8a7291ab72c13801eba181db5b673885d1

I can't judge the Nova/Cinder interactions, but I'm assuming the Lee got it right.

I'm not sure my block_device.py suggestion is worth a -1, so I'll leave this voteless.

What also bugged me is that the tests don't use the same order/logic as the code, so you have to go back to find the correct code block for the v2/v3/idempotent/non-idempotent case and make sure the unit test is asserting the correct cinder method got called."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-08-27 14:09:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

You know what - here: make the unit tests order match the code order. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-14035e1d-5cbb-4550-8675-2c7c1b7a9954)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 13:56:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7a7fd51d12d045ff134d55a4a1749c1feee0386/nova/compute/manager.py#L8158-L8160

Okay so this is a legit failure because pre_live_migration creates attachments *with* a connector, so our later attempt to update the attachment with the same connector fails. 

This calls the entire approach into question tbh as c-api doesn't allow any c-vol backend to be idempotent if the same connector is used....

Let me try this another way."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 15:52:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> Patch Set 16: Workflow-1
> 
> https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7a7fd51d12d045ff134d55a4a1749c1feee0386/nova/compute/manager.py#L8158-L8160
> 
> Okay so this is a legit failure because pre_live_migration creates attachments *with* a connector, so our later attempt to update the attachment with the same connector fails. 
> 
> This calls the entire approach into question tbh as c-api doesn't allow any c-vol backend to be idempotent if the same connector is used....

Ah the actual issue is that n-cpu is updating the connector on the original attachment thus the duplicate warning... For some reason self['attachment_id'] within the DriverBlockDevice object hasn't updated by the time we use it in refresh_connection_info."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 16:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 17:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 16:07:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP block_device: Use the attachment update API to refresh connection_info

attachment_get translates into a no-op volume show in c-api and does no
refresh the connection_info related to the volume....

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=update-an-attachment-detail#update-an-attachment

Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53
Closes-bug: #1860913
'}, {'created': '2020-04-18 14:55:08.000000000', 'message': 'block_device: Use the attachment update API to refresh connection_info

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53
'}, {'created': '2020-04-22 17:03:27.000000000', 'message': 'WIP block_device: Rework refresh_connection_info

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014348.html

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53
'}, {'created': '2020-05-06 14:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'block_device: Use initialize APIs to refresh when reported as idempotent

There are unfortunately no guarantees that calls to the
initialize_connection or attachment_update Cinder APIs are idempotent.
As a result callers have no idea if it is ever safe to make repeat calls
to the API when attempting to refresh connection_info.

This change begins to use the initialize_idempotent key returned in the
connection_info of the NFS (I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a)
and Ceph (Ibc62dd8a7291ab72c13801eba181db5b673885d1) volume drivers to
identify when it is actually safe to use these calls to refresh the
connection_info of a bdm in Nova.

This resolves bug #1860913 as the stored connection_info for the NFS
volume is now correctly refreshed after a snapshot is taken when a
cinderv3 attachment is used by calling the attachment_update cinder API.

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53

There are unfortunately no guarantees that calls to the
initialize_connection or attachment_update Cinder APIs are idempotent.
As a result callers have no idea if it is ever safe to make repeat calls
to the API when attempting to refresh connection_info.

This change begins to use the initialize_idempotent key returned in the
connection_info of the NFS (I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a)

identify when it is actually safe to use these calls to refresh the
connection_info of a bdm in Nova.

This resolves bug #1860913 as the stored connection_info for the NFS
volume is now correctly refreshed after a snapshot is taken when a
cinderv3 attachment is used by calling the attachment_update cinder API.

Note that the behaviour of calling the cinderv2 initialize_connection
API for volumes that don't reference an attachment remains unchanged.

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53

"}, {'created': '2021-03-12 11:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'block_device: Use initialize APIs to refresh when reported as idempotent

There are unfortunately no guarantees that calls to the
initialize_connection or attachment_update Cinder APIs are idempotent.
As a result callers have no idea if it is ever safe to make repeat calls
to the API when attempting to refresh connection_info.

This change begins to use the initialize_idempotent key returned in the
connection_info of the NFS (I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a)
and Ceph (Ibc62dd8a7291ab72c13801eba181db5b673885d1) volume drivers to
identify when it is actually safe to use attachment_update with cinderv3
based attachments to refresh the connection_info of a bdm in Nova.

No changes are made for legacy cinderv2 attachments as these have always
called initialize_connection and changing this now could easily cause
regressions for various volume backends.

This resolves bug #1860913 for cinderv3 attachments as the stored
connection_info for the NFS volume is now correctly refreshed after a
snapshot is taken when a cinderv3 attachment is used by calling the
attachment_update cinder API.

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53

commit_message:
WIP/DNM - block_device: Use initialize APIs to refresh when reported as idempotent

There are unfortunately no guarantees that calls to the
initialize_connection or attachment_update Cinder APIs are idempotent.
As a result callers have no idea if it is ever safe to make repeat calls
to the API when attempting to refresh connection_info.

This change begins to use the initialize_idempotent key returned in the
connection_info of the NFS (I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a)
and Ceph (Ibc62dd8a7291ab72c13801eba181db5b673885d1) volume drivers to
identify when it is actually safe to use attachment_update with cinderv3
based attachments to refresh the connection_info of a bdm in Nova.

No changes are made for legacy cinderv2 attachments as these have always
called initialize_connection and changing this now could easily cause
regressions for various volume backends.

This resolves bug #1860913 for cinderv3 attachments as the stored
connection_info for the NFS volume is now correctly refreshed after a
snapshot is taken when a cinderv3 attachment is used by calling the
attachment_update cinder API.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/722659
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/722081

Closes-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: Ibbd17dce9763511361cc4236661f834864e13d53

subject: nfs: Mark the initialize_connection API as idempotent in connection_info

In summary, the problem is with improper refresh of the connection info, i've few questions regarding this:

1) Is this issue specific to nfs or other *fs drivers as well (like quobyte, smbfs etc), since the original issue was reported against glusterfs
2) (not sure how relevant this is) but from the details on launchpad, after the snapshot creation, the original volume file freezes and instance starts writing to the snapshot file. IIUC snapshot is a point in time copy of the state, shouldn't the original volume file be written to and snapshot file should be kept intact?"}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-05-06 11:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/81/722081/3/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi/3b1be8c : SUCCESS in 1h 04m 20s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-05-06 14:05:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> In summary, the problem is with improper refresh of the connection
 > info, i've few questions regarding this:

There's no problem here for the NFS c-vol backend, rather the opposite. It is safe to make repeat calls to the initialize_connection API with this backend however the caller has no idea this is the case.

 > 1) Is this issue specific to nfs or other *fs drivers as well (like
 > quobyte, smbfs etc), since the original issue was reported against
 > glusterfs

I've not looked tbh but I'd assume so yes.

 > 2) (not sure how relevant this is) but from the details on
 > launchpad, after the snapshot creation, the original volume file
 > freezes and instance starts writing to the snapshot file. IIUC
 > snapshot is a point in time copy of the state, shouldn't the
 > original volume file be written to and snapshot file should be kept
 > intact?

That would avoid the need to refresh the connection_info but I can't think of a way to switch to that layout *and* keep things backwardly compatible for existing volumes with snapshots."}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2020-05-06 14:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In my opinion we should not add this information to the connection information.
This is internal Cinder driver information that should **not** be exposed to normal users (an admin could be a different thing).
Any Cinder user/consumer should assume drivers are not idempotent and act accordingly.

If other cores disagree, we should evaluate adding this as a driver class attribute (or instance attribute if idempotency is based on storage array/firmware) with a safe default (False) and it's the manager that sets the field instead of the driver for both, connection_information and driver capabilities."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 16:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> 
> In my opinion we should not add this information to the connection information.
> This is internal Cinder driver information that should **not** be exposed to normal users (an admin could be a different thing).
> Any Cinder user/consumer should assume drivers are not idempotent and act accordingly.
> 
> If other cores disagree, we should evaluate adding this as a driver class attribute (or instance attribute if idempotency is based on storage array/firmware) with a safe default (False) and it's the manager that sets the field instead of the driver for both, connection_information and driver capabilities.

That's fine but at this point I'll be throwing bug #1860913 back over to the cinder folks to refresh the connection_info associated with an attachment during cinder.volume.drivers.remotefs.RemoteFSSnapDriverBase._{create,delete}_snapshot_online as without something like this in connection_info n-cpu isn't going to be able to determine what is and isn't safe to call here."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-07-05 16:48:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The newer attachment api was supposed to address this. This call was never meant to be idempotent, then we discovered nova was calling it relatedly to get this info. Isn't nova supposed to be making the new calls now?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 16:58:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> The newer attachment api was supposed to address this. This call was never meant to be idempotent, then we discovered nova was calling it relatedly to get this info. Isn't nova supposed to be making the new calls now?

It's currently making a GET against the attachment and using the connection_info it provides.

The issue here was that the connection_info we were getting back hadn't been updated by the remotefs driver when creating or deleting snapshots so I wanted to update (PUT) the attachment with a fresh connector to get this recreated.

Talking to Gorka it seems like he is on-board with simply fixing the remotefs driver so it updates the connection_info in the attachment *before* n-cpu does the GET."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-07-05 17:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
nfs: Mark the initialize_connection API as idempotent in connection_info

There are unfortunately no guarantees that calls to the
initialize_connection API provided by each volume driver are idempotent.
As a result callers have no idea if it is ever safe to make repeat calls
to the API when attempting to refresh connection_info.

This change adds a simple initialize_idempotent key to the
connection_info['data'] dict returned by the NFS volume driver to
indicate that repeat calls to the initialize_connection for this driver
are indeed safe. This should then allow callers such as n-cpu to
correctly call the correct API to fetch (attachment show) or refresh
(attachment update) connection_info.

A NOTE and FIXME are left detailing a wrinkle when using the cinderv3
attachment update API that results in this key and mount_point_base
ending up in the nested data dict that means this key has been added
directly to this dict while strictly not belonging there.

Related-bug: #1860913
Change-Id: I2dd06c43c39ddb576fea9e5cbccffc096e77073a

CentOS 8 does not need it, but the current logic diverges for RHEL

Change-Id: I83cc5acc7c8cb99c45f8eec1ed84ded75b765693

commit_message:
pip-and-virtualenv: do not unconditionally enable EPEL for CentOS

CentOS 8 does not need it, but the current logic diverges for RHEL
and CentOS, treating all versions of CentOS the same.

Change-Id: I83cc5acc7c8cb99c45f8eec1ed84ded75b765693

commit_message:
Fix the build

Pin cryptography both in the wheelhouse and the
release-tools boilerplate. The latter comes from
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/148

Fix Zaza's expected application status after
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/451

Change-Id: I3d8fbdd8f464ae5d5f24f0b8786218fa13f7b893

commit_message:
Fix for the values in archive_delete_rows script

There was a mistake in the script for the archive_delete_rows cron for
rendering the values from the values files. Fix for taking the values
from the values file for --max-rows and --before options when enabled
using the values.yaml file.

Change-Id: Ib63920c497bbf9ac74e41bdfd0b2e580b95bebb0

needed, to kill it.

TODO:
- control os.fork timeout --> kill child PIDs if timeout
  and return error. Actually this is what is this patch about:
  to have a way to spawn a (cheap) process and control the time;
  in case of timeout --> os.kill (no mercy!)
- create new comm.Message item to check forked child permissions
  (testing)
- create new comm.Message item to check forked time (testing,
  benchmarking)

Change-Id: I3dd86ccc304fea04ff99f647ae19d77134faa5a2
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP][DNM] Move threads to processes

In this patch what I'm trying to do is to move from threads
to processes (os.fork) to execute the privsep commands. That
will allow us to have control over the running process and, if
needed, to kill it.

TODO:
- control os.fork timeout --> kill child PIDs if timeout
  and return error. Actually this is what is this patch about:
  to have a way to spawn a (cheap) process and control the time;
  in case of timeout --> os.kill (no mercy!)
- create new comm.Message item to check forked child permissions
  (testing)
- create new comm.Message item to check forked time (testing,
  benchmarking)

Change-Id: I3dd86ccc304fea04ff99f647ae19d77134faa5a2

subject: Call register_opts if no 'database' exists in conf
messages:
[{'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-10 06:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-10 12:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-06-10 14:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

hey there -

I apologize that I don't get to look at this stuff often and I may be rusty on the details, but looking again at the LegacyEngineFacade is in fact calling that _start() method and is updating cfg.CONF with the "database" group.  There's no difference between using either one.     it was done that way to preserve exactly what the previous EngineFacade system was doing.

IIUC here, the DuplicateOpt is telling us that two different systems are attempting to write the config with potentially different values.   The change here would have that oslo.db's options are simply ignored rather than reporting on the conflict, and that does not seem to be a good idea to do by default.

I would assume the Trove effort here moves around where the enginefacade is configured.  if it previously called LegacyEngineFacade up front and now it calls oslo.db enginefacade much later, I would advise making sure the new enginefacade is "started" at the same time as when the previous LegacyEngineFacade was started.   I would place a call to enginefacade.get_engine() at that same point to ensure the same initialization happens at the same time as it did before.'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-10 22:57:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Hello Hervé, Thank you for your answer and suggestion!

It may be the Trove's problem, but when I looked at the migration document and changed the Trove side, I got a Duplication Error that is a new exception for Trove, so I think that it was a problem of oslo.db rather than a problem of Trove. Is it possible to avoid throwing new exceptions that did not occur before when migrating or re-throw the exception as an error in oslo.db at least? The documentation for register_opts in oslo.config states that an error will occur if the same options are given. oslo.db doesn't currently check the same group exist. If you're concerned that you're hitting where the exception was until now, you can change the patch like this:

             if conf is not None:
                 if 'database' in conf:
                     raise DuplicateOptError('database') # discover errors as soon as possible
                 conf.register_opts(options.database_opts, 'database')

FYI：the migration document whe I changed the Trove side
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.db/latest/reference/api/oslo_db.sqlalchemy.html#oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade.LegacyEngineFacade
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.db/latest/user/usage.html

Here are primary lines of my migration code in Trove. It would be great if we could migrate with all these changes!

@@ -94,10 +113,12 @@ def _create_facade(options):

                 #                 use enginefacade.from_config() instead
                 database_opts = dict(CONF.database)
                 database_opts.pop('query_log')
-                _FACADE = session.EngineFacade(
-                    options['database']['connection'],
+                enginefacade.configure(sqlite_fk=False,
+                    __autocommit=True,
+                    expire_on_commit=False, 
                     **database_opts
                 )
+                _FACADE = MyContext()

Thanks in advance,
Hirotaka Wakabayashi"}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-11 00:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Michael, Thank you very much for comments!

 > IIUC here, the DuplicateOpt is telling us that two different
 > systems are attempting to write the config with potentially
 > different values.   The change here would have that oslo.db's
 > options are simply ignored rather than reporting on the conflict,
 > and that does not seem to be a good idea to do by default.
I agree with you. Is the following logic same with the current one? oslo.db raise an exception when a database group exists.
```
             if conf is not None:
                 if 'database' in conf:
                     raise DuplicateOptError('database') # discover errors as soon as possible
                 conf.register_opts(options.database_opts, 'database')

             url_args = self._url_args_for_conf(conf)
```


 > I would assume the Trove effort here moves around where the
 > enginefacade is configured.  if it previously called
 > LegacyEngineFacade up front and now it calls oslo.db enginefacade
 > much later, I would advise making sure the new enginefacade is
 > "started" at the same time as when the previous LegacyEngineFacade
 > was started.   I would place a call to enginefacade.get_engine() at
 > that same point to ensure the same initialization happens at the
 > same time as it did before.
The place where I call enginefacede is almost the same as LegacyEngineFacade... Any suggestions are appreciated for me.

Here is my reference code change to migration from LegacyEngineFacade to enginefacade:
```
diff --git a/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py b/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py
index 39a0f218..1e56ce83 100644
--- a/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py
+++ b/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@ import contextlib
 import threading
 
 from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import session
+from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import enginefacade
 from oslo_log import log as logging
 from sqlalchemy import MetaData
 
@@ -71,6 +72,24 @@ def configure_db(options, models_mapper=None):
             models.update(module.persisted_models())
         mappers.map(get_engine(), models)
 
+class MyContext(object):
+    "User-defined context class."
+    def get_engine(self, use_slave=False):
+        if use_slave:
+            ret = enginefacade.reader.get_engine()
+        else:
+            ret = enginefacade.writer.get_engine()
+        #print("MyContext get_engine type(ret) {}".format(type(ret))) # sqlalchemy.engine.base.Engine
+        return ret
+
+    def get_session(self, use_slave=False, **kwargs):
+        if use_slave:
+            sessionmaker = enginefacade.reader.get_sessionmaker()
+        else:
+            sessionmaker = enginefacade.writer.get_sessionmaker()
+        session = sessionmaker(**kwargs)
+        #print("MyContext get_session type(ret) {}".format(type(session))) # sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session
+        return session
 
 def _create_facade(options):
     global _LOCK, _FACADE
@@ -94,10 +113,12 @@ def _create_facade(options):
                 #                 use enginefacade.from_config() instead
                 database_opts = dict(CONF.database)
                 database_opts.pop('query_log')
-                _FACADE = session.EngineFacade(
-                    options['database']['connection'],
+                enginefacade.configure(sqlite_fk=False,
+                    __autocommit=True,
+                    expire_on_commit=False, 
                     **database_opts
                 )
+                _FACADE = MyContext()
     return _FACADE 
```
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007498#comment-155528

Thanks in advance,
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-06-11 02:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > 
 > > IIUC here, the DuplicateOpt is telling us that two different
 > > systems are attempting to write the config with potentially
 > > different values.   The change here would have that oslo.db's
 > > options are simply ignored rather than reporting on the conflict,
 > > and that does not seem to be a good idea to do by default.
 > I agree with you. Is the following logic same with the current one?
 > oslo.db raise an exception when a database group exists.

 > Hirotaka Wakabayashi

yes, right below where you call enginefacade.configure(), then call enginefacade.get_engine(), which will call the _start()  method that LegacyEngineFacade would call at that same point.  see if that solves the problem.'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-11 06:37:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michael, Thank you very much for your comment! Actually, I was not very confident in my reference code change.:) 

I surveyed the reason why no DuplicateOptError occurs when using LegacyEngineFacade. Please see the followings.

1. _TransactionFactory::_start() registers options to the "database" group only when _start() is called with *conf is not None*. 
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L481
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L496-L497

2. However, LegacyEngineFacade::init() defaultly calls _TransactionFactory::_start(conf=None).
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L1272-L1295
https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/src/branch/master/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py#L97-L100

3. As a result, when LegacyEngineFacade is used, DuplicateOptError exception never occurs. 

I wonder DuplicateOptError will not occur if _start(self, conf=False...) were _start(self, conf=None...), because LegacyEngineFacade::init(_conf=None) calls _TransactionFactory::_start(_conf). In that case, Trove's migration might have no problem.
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L481
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L1272-L1274

Any helps are appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-06-11 14:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Michael, Thank you very much for your comment! Actually, I was not
 > very confident in my reference code change.:)
 > 
 > I surveyed the reason why no DuplicateOptError occurs when using
 > LegacyEngineFacade. Please see the followings.
 > 
 > 1. _TransactionFactory::_start() registers options to the
 > "database" group only when _start() is called with *conf is not
 > None*.
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L481
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L496-L497
 > 
 > 2. However, LegacyEngineFacade::init() defaultly calls
 > _TransactionFactory::_start(conf=None).
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L1272-L1295
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/src/branch/master/trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py#L97-L100
 > 
 > 3. As a result, when LegacyEngineFacade is used, DuplicateOptError
 > exception never occurs.
 > 
 > I wonder DuplicateOptError will not occur if _start(self,
 > conf=False...) were _start(self, conf=None...), because
 > LegacyEngineFacade::init(_conf=None) calls _TransactionFactory::_start(_conf).
 > In that case, Trove's migration might have no problem.
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L481
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/src/branch/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L1272-L1274
 > 
 > Any helps are appreciated.
 > 
 > Thanks in advance,
 > Hirotaka Wakabayashi

Hi Hirotaka -

your analysis is correct.  hence why I am suggesting that in your new code, you add a single call to enginefacade.get_engine() which will call this _start method at this point.

whether or not we change oslo.db here, if this approach does resolve the problem, it at least confirms that we understand what's going on and also provides Trove with a workaround so that you can move forward with your patch for Trove.'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-12 09:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michael, Thank you very much for looking at my comment! I will try to add a single call to enginefacade.get_engine() and check if it resolve my problem. Even if problem will not be solved, I will try another approach like singleton oslo.config that Mr. Hervé Beraud told me. If I need your help again, I will ask you again. So I will abandon this ticket at this point.

Thank you very much!
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-13 01:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hello, I don't know this can help to tell this issue well, but I add one more comment on Trove's situation. I added a single call to enginefacade.get_engine() in Trove code to check if it resolves my problem, but Zuul's openstack-tox-py36 job is now failing.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735405/
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a36cb86910154baead04277477dd2688

If you think my code change is bad or not what you expected, please give your feedback.

Hirotaka Wakabayashi"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-06-13 02:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > add one more comment on Trove's situation. I added a single call to
 > enginefacade.get_engine() in Trove code to check if it resolves my
 > problem, but Zuul's openstack-tox-py36 job is now failing.
 > 
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735405/
 > https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a36cb86910154baead04277477dd2688
 > 
 > If you think my code change is bad or not what you expected, please
 > give your feedback.
 > 
 > Thanks in advance,
 > Hirotaka Wakabayashi

why don't we try to follow the approach of other openstack projects.    I'm not sure why this problem is happening here and not in others, I'm not that deeply familiar with oslo.config.

looking at projects like nova, keystone, neutron, they aren't doing any register_opts() of their own in the "database" group.  Nova is registering them for its "api_database" group but not for "database".  

why not use the options that oslo.db is registering and leave it at that ?'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-13 05:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Michael, Thank you for teaching me other projects use cases and sorry for confusing you. I am simply wondering if it is a migration issue from LegacyEngineFacade from enginefacade because I got this error after migration code change. However, if using the "database" group in Trove is a bad idea(because that group is an important group for oslo.db and potentially causes a problem like this issue), then I thinik migration code change is just a opening of that problem. If so, I should close this review issue. 

Thanks in advance, 
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-06-15 15:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hello Michael, Thank you for teaching me other projects use cases
 > and sorry for confusing you. I am simply wondering if it is a
 > migration issue from LegacyEngineFacade from enginefacade because I
 > got this error after migration code change. However, if using the
 > "database" group in Trove is a bad idea(because that group is an
 > important group for oslo.db and potentially causes a problem like
 > this issue), then I thinik migration code change is just a opening
 > of that problem. If so, I should close this review issue.
 > 
 > Thanks in advance,
 > Hirotaka Wakabayashi

the same condition should have occurred using LegacyEngineFacade, as this uses the same code.  so I'm not sure what has changed, but in any case, oslo.db should be responsible for setting up the "database" group in the global CONF.  that's one of its primary purposes.'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-16 02:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dear Michael, Thank you for your reply. I finally understood that first of all Trove should not register the "database" group to the global CONF, because oslo.db should do that, but is it correct?

Thanks in advance,
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-20 13:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-22 01:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-06-22 01:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hello Sean, Thank you very much for your comment! I fixed my commit message. Please correct me if it is strange.

Thanks in advance,
Hirotaka Wakabayashi'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-08-24 15:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

That is correct. The same group name should not be used in multiple projects, because of exactly what you've found here.

oslo.db has been using the database group for a long time. What changed that made this an issue for Trove now?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-07-05 15:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Call register_opts if no 'database' exists in conf

I try to replace LegacyEngineFacade with enginefacade but I got
DuplicateOptError because Trove's library initially calls
CONF.register_opts function with 'database' group and enginefacade also
internally calls CONF.register_opts with 'database' group.

One of my suggestion to solve this problem is to register cfg options
to the "database" group only if "database" group is not be registered.

Reference: My proposal ticket to use enginefacade instead of EngineFacade
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007498#comment-155528

Change-Id: Ib91c9e2fc287be72546f72fb2e6483e67da084b5
Closes-Bug: 1882877

commit_message:
Add reno and reset legacy policy deprecation expectation

Added a reno to support
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/799120
and ultimately removed the "anticipated to be removed in the Xena
development cycle" warnings on legacy policy support as the effort
is taking longer than the cross-team effort anticipated.

Notes added to the code highlight that we need to update the
warnings at that time to ensure we appropriately set expectations
as to when the legacy policies will be removed.

Change-Id: Ie23788abaa61742cdea208fb0cf026bdecaab525

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-24 16:56:59.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate [pxe]ip_version parameter

The parameter has not had any effect in the code since
the dual stack PXE work went into place with Ironic as options
are now generated and transmitted to Neutron for both IPv4 and
IPv6. This option is only used by the internal
``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method in
``ironic.common.pxe_utils``.

Third party drivers using the ``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method
should consider generating options for both IPv4 and IPv6 at all
times. See change
If7a296001e204ae0c9a49495731052ab33379628 for examples on how
to do this.

Change-Id: I343783389105f008ce6dafc8d25d93211710771a

Change-Id: I343783389105f008ce6dafc8d25d93211710771a
'}, {'created': '2021-06-28 13:59:40.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate [pxe]ip_version parameter

The parameter has not had any effect in the code since
the dual stack PXE work went into place with Ironic as options
are now generated and transmitted to Neutron for both IPv4 and
IPv6. This option is only used by the internal
``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method in
``ironic.common.pxe_utils`` as a fallback if the calling method
does not specify a version. However a later change resulted in the
default behavior calling the dhcp option generation explicitly
to generate both IPv4 and IPv6 parameters, making the option
entirely redundant.

Third party drivers using the ``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method
should consider generating options for both IPv4 and IPv6 at all
times. See change
If7a296001e204ae0c9a49495731052ab33379628 for examples on how
to do this.

Change-Id: I343783389105f008ce6dafc8d25d93211710771a
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate [pxe]ip_version parameter

The parameter has not had any effect in the code since
the dual stack PXE work went into place with Ironic as options
are now generated and transmitted to Neutron for both IPv4 and
IPv6. This option is only used by the internal
``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method in
``ironic.common.pxe_utils`` as a fallback if the calling method
does not specify a version. However a later change resulted in the
default behavior calling the dhcp option generation explicitly
to generate both IPv4 and IPv6 parameters, making the option
entirely redundant.

Third party drivers using the ``dhcp_options_for_instance`` method
should consider generating options for both IPv4 and IPv6 at all
times. See change
If7a296001e204ae0c9a49495731052ab33379628 for examples on how
to do this.

Change-Id: I343783389105f008ce6dafc8d25d93211710771a

interface while the execution of a clear job queue cleaning step is
proceeding.
Prior to this fix, the clean step would fail when powering off a node.

Task: 42641

(cherry picked from commit 741a4d8a88bbc51f5903fc00cc4f1decf8f4ea1a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 19:24:19.000000000', 'message': "[solum] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I9feee9886ffade1d501ccadc40c41423b0d36d5c
"}]
commit_message:
[solum] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I9feee9886ffade1d501ccadc40c41423b0d36d5c

commit_message:
fixes  availability zone filter when creating a share from snapshot

Fixes bug #1915706 that was discovered in  Manila UI.
Issue is invalid input error being raised, even when
availability_zone provided is the same, as parent share's.
The reason is availability_zone is name and source_share_az
is id in the filter [1]. Now, regardless of availability_zone
provided is id or name, it will be always converted to a name.
And if availability_zone is the same as parent share's
operation will complete successfully.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/2e27c71877fdb601ba90b44c3573d8e50e099042/manila/share/api.py#L200

Closes-Bug: #1915706
Change-Id: I5039b7adf563d926053b423a4cc6e175d3f1e5cf

commit_message:
Remove redundant defaults

This change removes some redundant definitions of default values
according to the following three points.

- The get method returns None by default if the key doesn't exist,
  so it is unnecessary to define None explicitly.

- Setting '' as parameter defaults is redundant because we always use
  "if CONF.get('<name>'):" to check whether the parameter is set.

- In oslo.config all options default to None unless the default
  parameter is explicitly set. Thus defining default=None is redundant.

Change-Id: Ib14b24b9054fe4d0efc3e03f9c6683ae999e3202

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 17:44:27.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust enable-stf.yaml for latest recommendations

Adjust the enable-stf.yaml to work with the latest recommendations for
use with Service Telemetry Framework. These changes provide the
appropriate parameters to result in telemetry data being sent to STF in

commit_message:
Adjust enable-stf.yaml for latest recommendations

Adjust the enable-stf.yaml to work with the latest recommendations for
use with Service Telemetry Framework. These changes provide the
appropriate parameters to result in telemetry data being sent to STF in
a format that it expects for dashboarding and alerting purposes.

Recommend configuration of ceilometer and collectd collection agents
plus data transport configuration with existing environment files in
order to avoid duplicating the resource registry for service enablement.
By separating the data collectors and data transports from the
configuration more flexibility for different architectures is possible.

Configuration options that have existing defaults defined in other
locations have also been removed in order to keep things cleaner.

Change-Id: I38d06056b56fb14c7162d546f6d688ba6ad59a5b
Signed-off-by: Leif Madsen <lmadsen@redhat.com>

subject: Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-07-04 20:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-07-05 10:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-04 20:23:31.000000000', 'message': "Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
"}]
commit_message:
Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)

commit_message:
Don't hard-code overcloud-full

This will soon be overcloud-hardened-uefi-full on master, and the
download will be of a qcow2 file, not a tar file.

This change moves whole_disk_images default setting to extras-common,
and also adds default variable overcloud_image, which is used wherever
'overcloud-full' is currently hard-coded.

Change-Id: Iba7833c16eae3d3129b7bab48434c66ec2e1efcf
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

One thing to note is https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/blob/master/templates/node_upgrade_post.sh.j2#L68 attempts to migrate workloads back to their original node.  The default action here is to live-migrate the instance as well. In order to ensure cold-migration is universally used (when the flag is enabled) it would need to be updated here as well.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2021-06-28 19:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Yariv based on our discussion today, here is the current WIP for workload updates I am working on to allow for differing actions based on the instance metadata [1].  This would allow for varying actions to occur in the same job.  The test matrix around instances that require cold-migration vs live-migration can grow rather large given both network and storage scenarios, so the hope is having the ability to do variable actions could help reduce job creation in the future.  Maybe I can build on the results of this commit and have the default action be determined by the value of upgrade-compute-cold-evacuate?

[{'created': '2021-07-05 13:40:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust enable-stf.yaml for latest recommendations

Adjust the enable-stf.yaml to work with the latest recommendations for
use with Service Telemetry Framework. These changes provide the
appropriate parameters to result in telemetry data being sent to STF in
a format that it expects for dashboarding and alerting purposes.

Recommend configuration of ceilometer and collectd collection agents
plus data transport configuration with existing environment files in
order to avoid duplicating the resource registry for service enablement.
By separating the data collectors and data transports from the
configuration more flexibility for different architectures is possible.

Configuration options that have existing defaults defined in other

commit_message:
Adjust enable-stf.yaml for latest recommendations

Adjust the enable-stf.yaml to work with the latest recommendations for
use with Service Telemetry Framework. These changes provide the
appropriate parameters to result in telemetry data being sent to STF in
a format that it expects for dashboarding and alerting purposes.

Recommend configuration of ceilometer and collectd collection agents
plus data transport configuration with existing environment files in
order to avoid duplicating the resource registry for service enablement.
By separating the data collectors and data transports from the
configuration more flexibility for different architectures is possible.

Configuration options that have existing defaults defined in other
locations have also been removed in order to keep things cleaner.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/787254
Change-Id: I38d06056b56fb14c7162d546f6d688ba6ad59a5b
Signed-off-by: Leif Madsen <lmadsen@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[collectd] Fix CollectdAmqpSendQueueLimit references

The option CollectdAmqpSendQueueLimit was introduced in [1]
to limit the memory usage of the collectd-amqp1 plugin.

The incorrect CollectdAmqpQueueLimit option is passed into
environment files.

References to the CollectdAmqpQueueLimit config option have
been replaced with CollectdAmqpSendQueueLimit, to allow for
correct configuration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/755288

Change-Id: Ibbcdfb1d148af33e5f4b82763119adf1d61b4203
(cherry picked from commit 9a30798b3e7dff23cae0df2ee4b0566d37d23937)

commit_message:
[OVN] Do not fail when processing SG rule deletion

When a security group rule deletion command is issued, before executing
the database operations, a "BEFORE_DELETE" event is raised.

The OVN handler attending to this event should not fail if the security
group rule does not exist; the database transaction [1]  will in case of
not finding it, raising the correct exception and HTTP 404 error:

  Jun 29 16:58:28 dev20 neutron-server[8820]: INFO neutron.wsgi [None \
    req-1821ec9f-2439-420b-80eb-1138896de865 demo admin] 192.168.10.70 \
    "GET /v2.0/security-group-rules/missing_sg_rule_example HTTP/1.1" \
    status: 404 len: 348 time: 0.0352871

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6196c0873b4af9abd9055bf92478ff05ae090104/neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py#L858-L868

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I58f6e5b309e089f6681d2c4bbff4ff7fda96435f
Closes-Bug: #1933638
(cherry picked from commit 6a74cd76fd006d7c88575fc7ae39a3b499ac7d54)

commit_message:
[OVN] Do not fail when processing SG rule deletion

When a security group rule deletion command is issued, before executing
the database operations, a "BEFORE_DELETE" event is raised.

The OVN handler attending to this event should not fail if the security
group rule does not exist; the database transaction [1]  will in case of
not finding it, raising the correct exception and HTTP 404 error:

  Jun 29 16:58:28 dev20 neutron-server[8820]: INFO neutron.wsgi [None \
    req-1821ec9f-2439-420b-80eb-1138896de865 demo admin] 192.168.10.70 \
    "GET /v2.0/security-group-rules/missing_sg_rule_example HTTP/1.1" \
    status: 404 len: 348 time: 0.0352871

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/6196c0873b4af9abd9055bf92478ff05ae090104/neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py#L858-L868

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I58f6e5b309e089f6681d2c4bbff4ff7fda96435f
Closes-Bug: #1933638
(cherry picked from commit 6a74cd76fd006d7c88575fc7ae39a3b499ac7d54)

commit_message:
Remove testr

* Remove tests and tools directories since openstack-specs-jobs runs
  only docs
* Remove .testr.conf as there are will be no tests directory present in
  this repository after this change and update .gitignore accordingly
* Use 3.18.0 as the minversion for tox in order to use
  allowlist_externals option

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I345f16d0956b8e397b282902a211159e11f902c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 16:11:38.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent matching unrelated images

Because regexes defined by Kayobe are not strict enough, Kolla can build
container images unrelated to the deployment. For example, the default
service configuration will build:

- centos-binary-barbican-keystone-listener (matches keystone)
- centos-binary-prometheus-memcached-exporter (matches memcached)

This commit makes regexes stricter to avoid unecessary builds. Note that
some images are still built unecessarily, such as nova-compute-ironic
when ironic is disabled or neutron-metadata-agent-ovn when ovn is
disabled.

Change-Id: I67f0e48ee03b150f6fe52b1a3e7e727b79207231
(cherry picked from commit f575f4b7fd11b4155b7f4f78981f71fd66f4d2c5)
'}, {'created': '2021-07-02 16:13:33.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent matching unrelated images

container images unrelated to the deployment. For example, the default
service configuration will build:

- centos-binary-barbican-keystone-listener (matches keystone)
- centos-binary-prometheus-memcached-exporter (matches memcached)

This commit makes regexes stricter to avoid unecessary builds. Note that
some images are still built unecessarily, such as nova-compute-ironic
when ironic is disabled or neutron-metadata-agent-ovn when ovn is

Change-Id: I67f0e48ee03b150f6fe52b1a3e7e727b79207231

'}]
commit_message:
Prevent matching unrelated images

Because regexes defined by Kayobe are not strict enough, Kolla can build
container images unrelated to the deployment. For example, the default
service configuration will build:

- centos-binary-barbican-keystone-listener (matches keystone)
- centos-binary-prometheus-memcached-exporter (matches memcached)

This commit makes regexes stricter to avoid unecessary builds. Note that
some images are still built unecessarily, such as nova-compute-ironic
when ironic is disabled or neutron-metadata-agent-ovn when ovn is
disabled.

Change-Id: I67f0e48ee03b150f6fe52b1a3e7e727b79207231
(cherry picked from commit f575f4b7fd11b4155b7f4f78981f71fd66f4d2c5)

[{'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-06-03 02:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-06-03 02:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-06-03 03:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I need to verify that our API actually treats name as optional argument / attribute. It could also be that the call from watcher-dashboard is simply wrong because name is required argument / attribute. Investigating this will take some time.'}, {'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-07-01 12:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> I need to verify that our API actually treats name as optional argument / attribute. It could also be that the call from watcher-dashboard is simply wrong because name is required argument / attribute. Investigating this will take some time.

Thanks for your review.
In fact, the position to call the method watcher_dashboard/api/watcher.Audit.create is https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard/src/branch/master/watcher_dashboard/content/audit_templates/tables.py#L66, params only passes audit_type and auto_trigger, but the method requires a positional parameter, name.
In addition, name is not a required argument when creating audit. commit_message:
Fix create audit fail from audit_template

The name is a positional parameter in create() of audit,
but this parameter is not defined when calling from the
audit template. This patch fix it.

Related Bug: #1930565
Change-Id: Id18945b881d150f972dbbd5522010be0157fba17

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-28 09:15:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ramdisk boot option handling

The current ramdisk deploy code expects a user to set the boot_option
capability to "ramdisk". Not only is it redundant, it's also not
documented, so chances are high nobody has ever done that.

As a side effect of e6bb99cd8ff94a24c3f2108e649c7ca39189d220 boot
interfaces no longer validate kernel/ramdisk/image if boot option
is "local". Unless a user explicitly sets boot option to "ramdisk",
the validation will be skipped for the ramdisk deploy.

This patch follows the pattern of the anaconda deploy and makes
get_boot_option always return "ramdisk" for the ramdisk deploy.

In the future we need to refactor this code so that the deploy interface
provides the boot option it works with, but that is a lot of changes.

Change-Id: I25c28df048c706f0c5b013b4d252f09d5a7e57bd
(cherry picked from commit d7a5b3469cfb5c16e122451e9cd8594d7a7671a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ramdisk boot option handling

The current ramdisk deploy code expects a user to set the boot_option
capability to "ramdisk". Not only is it redundant, it's also not
documented, so chances are high nobody has ever done that.

As a side effect of e6bb99cd8ff94a24c3f2108e649c7ca39189d220 boot
interfaces no longer validate kernel/ramdisk/image if boot option
is "local". Unless a user explicitly sets boot option to "ramdisk",
the validation will be skipped for the ramdisk deploy.

This patch follows the pattern of the anaconda deploy and makes
get_boot_option always return "ramdisk" for the ramdisk deploy.

In the future we need to refactor this code so that the deploy interface
provides the boot option it works with, but that is a lot of changes.

Change-Id: I25c28df048c706f0c5b013b4d252f09d5a7e57bd
(cherry picked from commit d7a5b3469cfb5c16e122451e9cd8594d7a7671a1)

commit_message:
Get the undercloud.conf file from where it actually is

Since the deprecation of Mistral in THT, we can't get the path of this
file by using hiera anymore. This patch will get it directly in its
original place ($HOME/undercloud.conf) by using *ansible_env.HOME* fact.

Impacted Validations:
 playbooks/ceilometerdb-size.yaml
 playbooks/check-network-gateway.yaml
 playbooks/check-undercloud-conf.yaml
 playbooks/container-status.yaml
 playbooks/ctlplane-ip-range.yaml
 playbooks/dhcp-provisioning.yaml
 playbooks/neutron-sanity-check.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-pre-deployment.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-prep.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-heat-purge-deleted.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-process-count.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-tokenflush.yaml

This patch also fixes every molecule tests accordingly.

NB: check_network_gateway molecule test is now voting in the CI.

Closes-Bug: 1907553

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iafc38c6cd99edee89ae0305f09fe7080df148331
(cherry picked from commit bc31f762c22b7edffd9429db9f61bbcb0546aa75)
(cherry picked from commit f4ea045e425f8c4e7a21e24c8e7c398a374db113)
(cherry picked from commit a3eafbd6a2e2b82abffe6a1e19f8b2af67b54df9)

commit_message:
Add policy rules for extraroute-atomic API

This patch adds default RBAC policy rules for {add,remove}-extraroute
API which was introduces few cycles ago.
To be consistent with rules for other APIs, it adds deprecated "old
style" rules and rules with personas and scopes at once.

Change-Id: I185055b9387a1d473e3a2b8903f35c3f490c6f31

[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:27:51.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib952d51523684ba21b1247a0cef59ea5552ecdca

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib952d51523684ba21b1247a0cef59ea5552ecdca

commit_message:
Manage constraints with testenv install_command

This prevents having to duplicate the -c{} deps argument
across all environments in tox.ini

Co-authored-by: XinxinShen <shenxinxin@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I898cb2382aedc5a8d4b929c09f057ecf57f638b2

subject: Prevent matching unrelated images
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-02 16:09:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-05 09:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-07-05 10:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 16:09:45.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent matching unrelated images

Because regexes defined by Kayobe are not strict enough, Kolla can build
container images unrelated to the deployment. For example, the default
service configuration will build:

- centos-binary-barbican-keystone-listener (matches keystone)
- centos-binary-prometheus-memcached-exporter (matches memcached)

This commit makes regexes stricter to avoid unecessary builds. Note that
some images are still built unecessarily, such as nova-compute-ironic
when ironic is disabled or neutron-metadata-agent-ovn when ovn is
disabled.

Change-Id: I67f0e48ee03b150f6fe52b1a3e7e727b79207231
(cherry picked from commit f575f4b7fd11b4155b7f4f78981f71fd66f4d2c5)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent matching unrelated images

Because regexes defined by Kayobe are not strict enough, Kolla can build
container images unrelated to the deployment. For example, the default
service configuration will build:

- centos-binary-barbican-keystone-listener (matches keystone)
- centos-binary-prometheus-memcached-exporter (matches memcached)

This commit makes regexes stricter to avoid unecessary builds. Note that
some images are still built unecessarily, such as nova-compute-ironic
when ironic is disabled or neutron-metadata-agent-ovn when ovn is
disabled.

Change-Id: I67f0e48ee03b150f6fe52b1a3e7e727b79207231
(cherry picked from commit f575f4b7fd11b4155b7f4f78981f71fd66f4d2c5)

[{'created': '2021-07-02 11:34:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update arp entry of snat port on qrouter ns

In some cases, the arp entry of snat port is not updated
in qrouter namespace. l3-agent calls get_ports_by_subnet()
while setting arps for the subnet. And the snat port is
not returned if it is still unbound. One of the scenario
this is observed is when router is created, external
gateway set and internal subnet attached to router in
quick succession.

This patch retrieves snat port details from router info
as well and updates arp entry for snat port.

Closes-Bug: #1933092
Change-Id: I7ee797b4b930306cf6360922d855f8b24f1b813d
'}, {'created': '2021-07-02 11:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update arp entry of snat port on qrouter ns

In some cases, the arp entry of snat port is not updated
in qrouter namespace. l3-agent calls get_ports_by_subnet()
while setting arps for the subnet. And the snat port is
not returned if it is still unbound. One of the scenario
this is observed is when router is created, external

quick succession.

This patch retrieves snat port details from router info
as well and updates arp entry for snat port.

Closes-Bug: #1933092
Change-Id: I7ee797b4b930306cf6360922d855f8b24f1b813d
'}]
commit_message:
Update arp entry of snat port on qrouter ns

In some cases, the arp entry of snat port is not updated
in qrouter namespace. l3-agent calls get_ports_by_subnet()
while setting arps for the subnet. And the snat port is
not returned if it is still unbound. One of the scenario
this is observed is when router is created, external
gateway set and internal subnet attached to router in
quick succession.

This patch retrieves snat port details from router info
as well and updates arp entry for snat port.

Closes-Bug: #1933092
Change-Id: I7ee797b4b930306cf6360922d855f8b24f1b813d

messages:
[{'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-22 01:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-22 02:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-01-22 04:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/771903/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 48m 19s'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-01-22 06:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Overall it seems fine to treat devices as down if they are not present on the bridge.'}, {'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-22 10:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-22 10:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-22 10:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:
