Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/771903/4 : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 51s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-01-22 14:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

This is not how the OVS agent handles the ports and the events.

The OVS agent has a polling manager to detect any change in the port list (create/update/delete). When a port is deleted, the the event is registered and the port is treated as deleted.

In the VM migration process, the port is updated (shouldn't be, but this is another topic) and then deleted.

If the "update" event is received in a first polling cycle. Then, in the next polling cycle, the port "delete" event is detected and thus the port is removed from the agent (including the flows).

If both events are processed in the same cycle, "process_ports_events" should remove the port from port_info['updated'] and should be treated a deleted only.

According to your log [1], in the last cycle you posted, the port is considered as "updated". If when the port is going to be processed [2] it doesn't appear in the OVS DB; that means has been deleted. But the deletion process should be done in the next cycle, when the "delete" event is actually received.

I would like to see that in those logs and confirm that the port "delete" event is received and processed by the OVS agent. If not, that's an error. But the patch you have submitted is incorrect.

[1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/801866/
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771903/4/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#1920'}, {'account_id': 30744, 'date': '2021-01-23 11:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> This is not how the OVS agent handles the ports and the events.
> 
> The OVS agent has a polling manager to detect any change in the port list (create/update/delete). When a port is deleted, the the event is registered and the port is treated as deleted.
> 
> In the VM migration process, the port is updated (shouldn't be, but this is another topic) and then deleted.
> 
> If the "update" event is received in a first polling cycle. Then, in the next polling cycle, the port "delete" event is detected and thus the port is removed from the agent (including the flows).
> 
> If both events are processed in the same cycle, "process_ports_events" should remove the port from port_info['updated'] and should be treated a deleted only.
> 
> According to your log [1], in the last cycle you posted, the port is considered as "updated". If when the port is going to be processed [2] it doesn't appear in the OVS DB; that means has been deleted. But the deletion process should be done in the next cycle, when the "delete" event is actually received.
> 
> I would like to see that in those logs and confirm that the port "delete" event is received and processed by the OVS agent. If not, that's an error. But the patch you have submitted is incorrect.
> 
> [1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/801866/
> [2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771903/4/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#1920

On the first cycle, we removed skipped devices from port_info['current'] [1], than, value of ports changes to this port_info['current'] [2]
On the second cycle, the variable `ports` will be passed in as the second argument of process_ports_events, now, neither port_info['current'] nor port_info['removed'] contains the skipped device; but _process_port func will add this device to port_info['removed'] because polling manager has already got the removed event, but but we didn't add it to port_info['current']; when _update_port_info_failed_devices_stats was executed, we removed this device from port_info['removed'] becuase it doesn't belong to port_info['current'] [3]

In short, we missed the opportunity to delete the port related resource in two loops.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/tag/17.0.0/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L2083
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/tag/17.0.0/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L2632
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/tag/17.0.0/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L1636'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-01-26 03:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-01-26 05:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/771903/4 : SUCCESS in 2h 17m 51s'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-02-09 03:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> This is not how the OVS agent handles the ports and the events.
> 
> The OVS agent has a polling manager to detect any change in the port list (create/update/delete). When a port is deleted, the the event is registered and the port is treated as deleted.
> 
> In the VM migration process, the port is updated (shouldn't be, but this is another topic) and then deleted.
> 
> If the "update" event is received in a first polling cycle. Then, in the next polling cycle, the port "delete" event is detected and thus the port is removed from the agent (including the flows).
> 
> If both events are processed in the same cycle, "process_ports_events" should remove the port from port_info['updated'] and should be treated a deleted only.
> 
> According to your log [1], in the last cycle you posted, the port is considered as "updated". If when the port is going to be processed [2] it doesn't appear in the OVS DB; that means has been deleted. But the deletion process should be done in the next cycle, when the "delete" event is actually received.
> 
> I would like to see that in those logs and confirm that the port "delete" event is received and processed by the OVS agent. If not, that's an error. But the patch you have submitted is incorrect.
> 
> [1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/801866/
> [2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771903/4/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#1920

for a port migration, do we assume nova first call api to activate binding on dest, then cleanup ports on br-int or vice versa?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-04-14 13:29:41.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 31769, 'date': '2021-07-05 09:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> This is not how the OVS agent handles the ports and the events.
> 
> The OVS agent has a polling manager to detect any change in the port list (create/update/delete). When a port is deleted, the the event is registered and the port is treated as deleted.
> 
> In the VM migration process, the port is updated (shouldn't be, but this is another topic) and then deleted.
> 
> If the "update" event is received in a first polling cycle. Then, in the next polling cycle, the port "delete" event is detected and thus the port is removed from the agent (including the flows).
> 
> If both events are processed in the same cycle, "process_ports_events" should remove the port from port_info['updated'] and should be treated a deleted only.
> 
> According to your log [1], in the last cycle you posted, the port is considered as "updated". If when the port is going to be processed [2] it doesn't appear in the OVS DB; that means has been deleted. But the deletion process should be done in the next cycle, when the "delete" event is actually received.
> 
> I would like to see that in those logs and confirm that the port "delete" event is received and processed by the OVS agent. If not, that's an error. But the patch you have submitted is incorrect.
> 
> [1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/801866/
> [2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771903/4/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#1920

Sorry to disturb you after such a long time, I have some different opinions. When the confim_resize is executed, the port will be deleted from br-int by nova, then in the next cycle the OVS agent will detect the port "delete" event and start the deletion process that delete related flows. When the port is deleted in the "update" cycle and the port is be processed [2], it will be add to skipped_devices and remove from port_info['current']. In next cycle, OVS agent detect the port "delete" event and start "delete" cycle, it will be do nothing because the port is not in port_info['current'][3], and this will result in stale flows left.
[3]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771903/4/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#1634'}]

[{'created': '2021-01-22 01:57:44.000000000', 'message': 'fix stale flows problem when migrating or resizing vms

[OVS]On integration bridge, if we delete a port and update it in the meanwhile,
it's possiable that we get stale devices details list and the related flows
will not be deleted because the treat_devices_skipped method doesn't delete
any flows. There is a traffic broken by these stale flows. This patch merged
"skipped_devices" into port_info['removed'], because deleting port resource in
l2 agent extensions and deleting stale flows will be executed in method
`treat_devices_removed`.

Change-Id: Ifca6316b706103549f6a109d892db891d855588b
Closes-Bug: #1912450
Related-Bug: #1737892

commit_message:
fix stale flows problem when migrating or resizing vms

[OVS] On integration bridge, if we delete a port and update it in the
meanwhile, it's possiable that we get stale devices details list and
the related flows will not be deleted because the treat_devices_skipped
method doesn't delete any flows. There is a traffic broken by these
stale flows. This patch merged "skipped_devices" into
port_info['removed'], because deleting port resource in l2 agent
extensions and deleting stale flows will be executed in method
`treat_devices_removed`.

Change-Id: Ifca6316b706103549f6a109d892db891d855588b
Closes-Bug: #1912450
Related-Bug: #1737892

commit_message:
Rehome DHCP_IPV{4,6}_TABLE constants to neutron-lib

2 new constants DHCP_IPV4_TABLE and DHCP_IPV6_TABLE were added to
the openvswitch agent's constant module in [1].
As whole this constants module is now rehomed to the neutron_lib,
this patch also rehomes that 2 new constants.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/776567

Change-Id: I242a3191e7481c0b75a5785db23dcc031d74140a

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I561d6dfe70b956ce9c67aa3277b7968dcae6e487

commit_message:
osc-lib release 2.4.1

Patch release of osc-lib which resolves issues during shell
cleanup, specifically when generating command completions for
shell integration. Also includes commit for cleaning up of session
object if available.

Change-Id: I97f38b96bce39d66072128141470679d2c03cc1e

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-06-29 07:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI the hirsute failure is unrelated to this change, but caused by https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-cinder-purestorage/+bug/1933818 instead. From a CI perspective this review is safe to land'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-06-29 07:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Simon, thank you very much for the contribution. These are a lot of new features and we are going to want "a similar lot" of functional tests. Functional tests live at https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests . Here is how to run them: https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/testing.html#functional-testing . So you will have two reviews open at the same time: this one and a pull-request in zaza-openstack-tests. The way to tell this Gerrit review to make use of your zaza-openstack-tests pull-request is done by adding "func-test-pr" to your commit message: https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/making-a-change.html#functional-test-changes . You may want to consider cutting this entire change into smaller pieces, one per feature. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 13425, 'date': '2021-06-29 13:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Simon, thank you very much for the contribution. These are a lot of new features and we are going to want "a similar lot" of functional tests. Functional tests live at https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests . Here is how to run them: https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/testing.html#functional-testing . So you will have two reviews open at the same time: this one and a pull-request in zaza-openstack-tests. The way to tell this Gerrit review to make use of your zaza-openstack-tests pull-request is done by adding "func-test-pr" to your commit message: https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/making-a-change.html#functional-test-changes . You may want to consider cutting this entire change into smaller pieces, one per feature. Thank you!

Thanks for seeing the hirsute issue and raising the bug. I have many questions about these functional tests. Notably that there do not seem to be any current tests for the features in the current charm, so I'm not even sure of how these tests would be written. Also, given these features are specific to the Pure backend how can any of the CI actually perform functional tests without a Pure backend. 
Are the tests to look for formatting errors in the constructed `cinder.conf` or something else?'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-01 07:28:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

re: functional tests, as discussed offline they wouldn't be asserting much, so they wouldn't have much value. Simon, would you like to also prepare a review for the future release-notes, announcing these new features? Such a review looks like https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-guide/+/796873 and is there rendered at https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/2110.html - Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-07-01 12:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-01 13:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-01 13:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Rebased on top of re-enabled existing functional tests. Waiting on CI. This change looks good to me. Also see my comment about release notes, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13425, 'date': '2021-07-01 14:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 13425, 'date': '2021-07-01 22:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 08:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The created volume is in error state and cinder-volume.log shows this exception. I'm pretty sure this is a regression introduced by this change. @Simon, do you see what may be the culprit?

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/cinder-volume", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/cinder/cmd/volume.py", line 198, in main
    _launch_services_posix()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/cinder/cmd/volume.py", line 169, in _launch_services_posix
    launcher.wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/service.py", line 654, in wait
    self.conf.log_opt_values(LOG, logging.DEBUG)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2589, in log_opt_values
    _sanitize(opt, getattr(group_attr, opt_name)))
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 3134, in __getattr__
    return self._conf._get(name, self._group)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2631, in _get
    value, loc = self._do_get(name, group, namespace)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2705, in _do_get
    raise ConfigFileValueError(message)
oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFileValueError: Value for option image_volume_cache_enabled from LocationInfo(location=<Locations.user: (4, True)>, detail='/etc/cinder/cinder.conf') is not valid: Unexpected boolean value 'None'
```'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 08:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

found it! :)'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 08:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 12:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Consistently on Victoria+, the new volume is stuck in "creating" state. I suspect this review is changing the default somewhere, as the test gate was green for Victoria+ just before this review. Checking the logs'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 12:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Actually focal-wallaby passed, so it's not "consistently". Maybe the test isn't waiting long enough, or re-trying enough. Investigating.'}, {'account_id': 13425, 'date': '2021-07-02 12:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 12:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 14:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-02 15:35:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

FYI confirmed offline with Simon: the defaults in config.yaml are inline with the driver's defaults."}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-07-05 08:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks!'}]

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-22 13:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Needs to get fixed here before these patches land https://github.com/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/blob/master/openstack_virtual_baremetal/build_nodes_json.py#L153-L163'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-06-22 14:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Needs to get fixed here before these patches land https://github.com/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/blob/master/openstack_virtual_baremetal/build_nodes_json.py#L153-L163

Why?
We use the '--physical-network' with ovs-build-nodes-json in the TripleO CI since https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/30499. And job's for releases that don't support 'ports' is not run any longer, see discussion on https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/33677."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-22 14:36:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Why?
> We use the '--physical-network' with ovs-build-nodes-json in the TripleO CI since https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/30499. And job's for releases that don't support 'ports' is not run any longer, see discussion on https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/33677.

because I don't use --physical-network so my files have always had 'mac' instead of 'prts'.  If mac won't work, we shouldn't continue to use it by default or it should be inverted to be optional to use the old way."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-06-22 14:51:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> because I don't use --physical-network 

oh, ok. Let me propose a patch to change the default in OVB for you. :-)"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-06-22 15:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Why?
> > We use the '--physical-network' with ovs-build-nodes-json in the TripleO CI since https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/30499. And job's for releases that don't support 'ports' is not run any longer, see discussion on https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/config/+/33677.
> 
> because I don't use --physical-network so my files have always had 'mac' instead of 'prts'.  If mac won't work, we shouldn't continue to use it by default or it should be inverted to be optional to use the old way.

commit_message:
Drop deprecated "macs" field in nodes_json

In change I74d4178dbb0cfe8c934ce15e3e7c9bb1c469de10
the "macs" field in nodes_json was deprecated and
replaced by the "ports" field.

It has been several cycles with a deprecation warning
in the logs. Remove convert_nodes_json_mac_to_ports
which keept backward compatibility.

Depends-On: Ia4fa4b950114c5fcc787a7ffb957360c65c850c9
Depends-On: Ib520d5e8366159917076c35cf80efb4b5fcffca6
Change-Id: I559cc656758843a8b1432069952b8d917fc4649a
